meanings.definition: Adhering strictly to a set of rules or principles
meanings.sent1: The teacher's rigoristic approach to grading left no room for leniency.
meanings.sent2: Her rigoristic adherence to the schedule ensured everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The rigoristic chef insisted on following the recipe to the letter, even for a simple dish.
meanings.sent4: His rigoristic dedication to his workout routine was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The rigoristic guidelines for the experiment were crucial for accurate results.

meanings.definition: Characterized by strictness or severity in judgment
meanings.sent1: The judge's rigoristic decision shocked everyone in the courtroom.
meanings.sent2: Her rigoristic critique of the artwork left the artist feeling discouraged.
meanings.sent3: The rigoristic librarian refused to allow any noise in the reading area.
meanings.sent4: The rigoristic storm clouds gathered ominously in the sky.
meanings.sent5: His rigoristic evaluation of the project highlighted every flaw.

meanings.definition: Someone who is excessively strict or rigid in their beliefs or practices
meanings.sent1: The school principal was known as a rigoristic when it came to enforcing rules.
meanings.sent2: She was labeled a rigoristic for her unwavering stance on traditional values.
meanings.sent3: The rigoristic refused to try any new foods, sticking to the same meals every day.
meanings.sent4: He was a rigoristic in his approach to time management, never deviating from his schedule.
meanings.sent5: The old man was a rigoristic about keeping his garden perfectly manicured.
